Scott was perhaps the most meticulous and solid researcher in this field; if there’s a discrepancy between scholars, usually Scott is right! E. P. This cite is to the American edition; there’s also a Philippine edition by Ateneo de Manila UP. Linda A. Newson, Conquest and Pestilence in the Early Spanish Philippines: Linda A. Newson: 9780824832728: Amazon.com: Books. State of the art on the demographic impact of Spanish colonialism, which was much greater than most of us had thought. There are others, but these strike me as among the best, depending of course on how deeply you want to get into the topic and what particular aspects of it interest you the most.
